creator: hemant.verma@fiserv.co.in
text:
Hi,

I'm using JMeter 2.3.1 image on windows.I tried to load the wsdl file by using WebService(SOAP) Request sampler.But not able to load that wsdl file.The POP-Up appears saying"The WSDL was not valid,please doulble check the URL." but i have checked wsdl file twice ,also working fine in our project and successfully opened on IE browser. The Wsdl is also using the namespaces.

Please Clarify.

Thanks,
Hemant

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
What is the URL for the WSDL file?

By the way, in 2.3.1 the sampler cannot load WSDL from a file.
This is fixed in 2.3.2 (due soon)

creator: hemant.verma@fiserv.co.in
text:
Hi Sebb,

 I tried to load the wsdl from below mentioned URL.

URL : http://www.dataaccess.com/webservicesserver/numberconversion.wso?WSDL

It is also giving me same error.

Thanks,
Hemant

Works fine for me in JMeter 2.3.1

What does the jmeter log file show?
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
I have attached the log file and the screen shot for the same.Steps that i have followed :

1. Create the Thread group in test Plan.
2.Create the WebService(SOAP) sampler.
3.Mention the URl for WDSL to load:http://www.dataaccess.com/webservicesserver/numberconversion.wso?WSDL
4.Click the Load WSDl.
5.I got the resulr as attached in the screen shot.

If you have done something different then please let me know to proceed further.

Thanks for the quick support you are providing.

Thanks,
Hemant
creator: hemant.verma@fiserv.co.in
sebb@apache.org
text:
No sign of any problems in the log file.

I cannot reproduce the problem.

What happens if you try to load the WSDL using the HTTP Sampler?
Could you please send me the screenshot? It will help me to configure the same at me end.
creator: hemant.verma@fiserv.co.in

text:
Created attachment 22103
Test plan to download WSDL

Try the attached test plan

text:
Hi Sebb,

Thanks!! Its done by using HTTP Sampler.But it is not working by using WebService(SOAP) sampler. Does i have to do something else to make it work with WebService(SOAP) sampler.

I've no idea why this does not work.

Can you attach a very simple failing test plan with just the WebService sampler?
